page.title: 16Area Schools
page.content: The area was originally served by three schools but the Thorney Hill school was closed and the buildings became a private dwelling. The two remaining schools are Bransgore County Primary School and Sopley County Primary School.{Bransgore School}was first opened in 1895 as a 'national' school accomodating 174 pupils. The school now serves a growing community and accommodates more than 300 children between the ages of five and eleven. {Sopley School}is not in the village of Sopley but is situated at South Ripley. It was built to replace the very small schools of both villages of Ripley and Sopley. The school is well supported by the local community and teaches over sixty children of Primary age.
